meanings.definition: Catching or trapping (someone or something) using a snare.
meanings.sent1: The hunter was snaring rabbits in the forest.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys snaring fish in the river with her net.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon tried snaring the picnic basket with a clever trick.
meanings.sent4: His words were like snares, snaring her attention effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The spider skillfully spun its web, snaring unsuspecting insects.

meanings.definition: The act of setting a snare to catch prey.
meanings.sent1: Before dawn, he prepared for the snaring of wild rabbits.
meanings.sent2: The snaring of birds requires patience and precision.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy attempt at snaring the squirrel ended in laughter.
meanings.sent4: The snaring of the elusive fox proved to be a challenging task.
meanings.sent5: The ancient art of snaring has been passed down through generations.

meanings.definition: A device consisting of a noose for catching small game.
meanings.sent1: The trapper carried his snaring equipment into the woods.
meanings.sent2: She carefully set up the snaring to catch the elusive hare.
meanings.sent3: The snaring accidentally caught a twig instead of the intended prey.
meanings.sent4: The snaring was so well-crafted that it never failed to capture its target.
meanings.sent5: The old snaring had intricate designs etched into its wooden handle.
